alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 7:57PM EST until January 06 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and northern West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Washington. In northern West Virginia, Pleasants and Tyler. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM EST, rain gauges and spotters reported heavy rain in the warned area, and law enforcement reported road closures. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Marys, Middlebourne, Paden City, Sistersville, Belmont, Newport, Matamoras, Macksburg, Friendly, Lower Salem, Point Lookout, New Matamoras, Arvilla and Maxwell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
